title: Facebook Reports Earnings on Wednesday. Expectations Are High.
text: Expectations are high: a profit of $8.8 billion, or $3.52 a share---roughly 70% growth---and $27.9 billion in revenue, a jump of nearly 50%.

title: 5 Spectacular Earnings Charts
text: These 5 stocks keep hitting new highs as the companies keep surprising on earnings. Will they do it again?

title: Facebook Reports Earnings on Wednesday. What To Know.
text: Expectations are high: a profit of $8.8 billion, or $3.52 a share---roughly 70% growth---and $27.9 billion in revenue, a jump of nearly 50%.

title: Facebook stock price predictions for Q3 ahead of Q2 earnings
text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ:FB) shares on Tuesday fell 1.25% before surging 1.70% in the after-hours trading. The social media giant reports its fiscal second-quarter results Wednesday after markets close, and analysts are optimistic amid rising ad spend and growing Asia MAUs.

title: Why Nvidia, Facebook, Amazon, and Pinduoduo Fell Today
text: These tech companies suffered from broader market weakness, earnings reports from peers, and uncertainty around China-based stocks.

title: Why Tech Investors Should not Ignore These ETFs
text: Communication Services ETFs usually do not get investors' attention

title: Like Facebook Stock for a Favorable Q2 Earnings Play
text: There's enough to like in FB stock for shorter-term investors to play the tech giant's Q2 release this week using a Facebook options spread. The post Like Facebook Stock for a Favorable Q2 Earnings Play appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Facebook (FB) Option Traders Ready to 'Like' Earnings
text: A significant amount of call options remains in the open interest for Facebook, and option premiums are unusually high right now.

title: Facebook's Super App Flywheel Effect Underappreciated
text: As the largest social media platform, Facebook is set to capitalize on the booming creator economy with new tools and monetization options offered to creators.

title: Options Traders See Bull Flag Ahead Of Facebook's Q2 Print
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ:FB) is set to print its second-quarter earnings results after the closing bell on Wednesday and the stock ran up toward the event before beginning to consolidate the move on Monday. On Tuesday, the social media giant's stock continued to pull back, amid overall market weakness, and options traders took advantage of the dip to position themselves in $1.86 million worth of bullish call contracts.

title: Facebook's new privacy changes for Instagram's teen users met with both praise, scrutiny
text: Facing an onslaught of ongoing criticism, Facebook said that it's taking several steps to make Instagram safer and private for teens.

title: Facebook Ends Advertisements Targeted At Children Below 18: Bloomberg
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) has stopped targeting ads to children below eighteen based on their interests or their activity on other apps and websites, Bloomberg reported. The changes will apply to Facebook's legacy site, photo-sharing app Instagram, and Messenger communication app.

title: Facebook Earnings: What to Look For
text: Facebook (FB) reports Q2 earnings after market close on July 28. Can it keep boosting revenue as growth slows in monthly active users (MAU)?

title: Will International User Growth Aid Facebook's (FB) Q2 Earnings?
text: Facebook's (FB) second-quarter 2021 performance is likely to reflect a burgeoning international user base and investments on promoting e-commerce.

title: Earnings Previews: Facebook, Ford, PayPal, Qualcomm
text: Three of the five largest U.S. traded companies will report June quarter earnings after markets close Tuesday.

title: Facebook will restrict ad targeting of under-18s
text: Facebook Inc will stop allowing advertisers to target people under 18 on its platforms based on their interests or their activity on other sites, it said on Tuesday in a slew of announcements about young users.

title: Facebook: You Should Worry About The Growth Slowdown
text: Facebook has been warning investors every other quarter or so that they shouldn't expect the same high growth rates moving forward.

title: Facebook Wants to Dominate Virtual Reality
text: Facebook is buying up the biggest and best names in VR in a bid to rule the market.

title: Demand for Digital Advertising Is Exploding
text: Results from Snap and Twitter show advertisers are willing to accept higher ad prices.

title: Google, Facebook set to squash initial iOS fears, show big revenue jump
text: Wall Street expects Alphabet Inc and Facebook Inc to report a surge in digital ad sales this week after smaller rivals showed soaring demand, bolstering expectations that the impact of Apple Inc's privacy changes has not yet been felt.

title: Facebook Said To Explore Letting Oculus Move Users Share Workout Data With Apple's Health App
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) may let the users of its Oculus virtual-reality headset synchronize workout data with Apple Inc's (NASDAQ: AAPL) Health application, Bloomberg reported Monday. What Happened: Should Facebook go ahead with its plan, users will be able to sync Oculus Move data with iPhone's Health app, as per code discovered by iOS developer Steve Moser and shared with Bloomberg.
